meanings.definition: The state or quality of being inferior.
meanings.sent1: Her inferiorities made her doubt her abilities.
meanings.sent2: He struggled with his inferiorities when comparing himself to his classmates.
meanings.sent3: Despite his inferiorities, he always found a way to make others smile.
meanings.sent4: The weight of his inferiorities felt like a heavy burden on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of his inferiorities clouded his mind with self-doubt.

meanings.definition: A feeling or belief of being less valuable or important than others.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't shake off the feeling of inferiorities in social situations.
meanings.sent2: His inferiorities held him back from pursuing his dreams.
meanings.sent3: His inferiorities seemed to disappear when he was surrounded by loved ones.
meanings.sent4: The shadow of his inferiorities loomed over his confidence.
meanings.sent5: The weight of her inferiorities felt like a constant burden on her heart.
